descr: "A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Condition resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation)."

fields.name: clinicalStatus
fields.descr: "The clinical status of the condition."

fields.name: verificationStatus
fields.descr: "The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition."

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "A category assigned to the condition."

fields.name: severity
fields.descr: "A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis."

fields.name: bodySite
fields.descr: "The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "Encounter during which the condition was first asserted."

fields.name: onsetDateTime
fields.descr: "Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician."

fields.name: onsetAge
fields.descr: "Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician."

fields.name: onsetPeriod
fields.descr: "Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician."

fields.name: onsetRange
fields.descr: "Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician."

fields.name: onsetString
fields.descr: "Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician."

fields.name: abatementDateTime
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: abatementAge
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: abatementBoolean
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: abatementPeriod
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: abatementRange
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: abatementString
fields.descr: "The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called \"abatement\" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with \"remission\" or \"resolution\" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate."

fields.name: assertedDate
fields.descr: "The date on which the existance of the Condition was first asserted or acknowledged."

fields.name: asserter
fields.descr: "Individual who is making the condition statement."

fields.name: stage
fields.descr: "Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments."

fields.name: evidence
fields.descr: "Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."

fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
